sentences.english: Enjoy a free $25 cash voucher with a purchase of two quarts of ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 惠顾两磅装雪糕两筒，可免费获赠$25现金券一张。

sentences.english: Passes to spectator stand and beer coupons are offered to bona-fide visitors only.
sentences.chinese: 观赏区入场券及啤酒畅饮券只供访港旅客使用。

sentences.english: One e-voucher can only be used in one transaction.
sentences.chinese: 每宗交易仅可使用一张电子现金券。

sentences.english: A sufficient number of international reply coupons (at least five).
sentences.chinese: 是说最少五张回邮券么？

sentences.english: Only one CE cash coupon can be used for one CE program.
sentences.chinese: 每张CE现金券只可用于一个持续进修课程。

sentences.english: Handsome wave SiMaKong font silly, know the source of things or because reserve notes.
sentences.chinese: 帅飘说司马空不傻，知道事情的根源还是因为储备券。

sentences.english: He's decided to give away a coupon for two free draft beers to those who complete the survey.
sentences.chinese: 他决定放弃了两个免费的生啤酒券那些谁完成调查。

sentences.english: The coupon printer functions via a parallel port interface.
sentences.chinese: 通过一个并行接口券打印机功能。

sentences.english: We have only one welcome drink coupon for each guest.
sentences.chinese: 我们的每一位客人都只给一张迎宾饮料券。

sentences.english: The city all says the Wen Zhou City deer using Suningyi to buy ticket , where that ticket looks for?
sentences.chinese: 温州鹿城都说用苏宁易购券，那个券在哪里找？

sentences.english: So you really think that buying twenty lotto tickets will secure a win?
sentences.chinese: 所以你真的觉得买二十张乐透彩券就一定会中？

sentences.english: It is also hard to argue that food-stamp recipients are undeserving.
sentences.chinese: 想要证明食品券领取者不配领取救济同样是件难事。

sentences.english: Please go to the Forms Center to download the form, then mail it to Scottrade.
sentences.chinese: 请到史考特券网站“表格中心”下载“交易授权书”。

sentences.english: The fifth part has tracked and investigated the policy of the training vouchers.
sentences.chinese: 第五部分追踪调查培训券政策。

sentences.english: Per stay will gain 2 complimentary golf tickets.
sentences.chinese: 每房赠送2张免费高尔夫专业练习场体验券。

definition: to exchange for (sth of equal value or utility)/to use in lieu/to redeem (a coupon etc)/to use to offset (an amount owed etc)
(Tw) to put money into (a stored-value card or pre-paid phone account)/to top up
abbr. for 特別優惠|特别优惠[te4 bie2 you1 hui4]/ex gratia
group buying/collective buying/buying by a group of individuals who negotiate a discount for the group
fukubukuro or "lucky bag", Japanese New Year custom where merchants offer grab bags containing random products at a steep discount
